intro: Euplassa occidentalis, commonly known as the western euplassa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Euplassa occidentalis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
